messages.message:
Website Manager-Do you know anyone?

Hi Brian, 

Staffing Strong is recruiting for a Website Manager for a client in Scottsdale, AZ. They will have an understanding of best practices in all aspects of website management, including UX/UI, digital content development, conversion optimization, and A/B testing. They will identify and track the KPI’s that support organizational goals, and will be responsible for SEO and website performance analytics.

Implement marketing strategy and site content schedule for website, updating with seasonal and promotional content
Develop web strategy for launches of new products and services
Identify traffic and conversion trends across the site and identify opportunities for improvement
Recommend and implement testing to improve the website experience
Lead SEO optimization with 3rd party vendor support
Monitor and report on customer journey and site experience, providing recommendations for improvements
Research competitor site experience to identify trends
Constantly evaluate industry innovation and best practices to identify potential challenges or opportunities and recommend future enhancements
Manage Umbraco CMS system and push content 
Ensure web pages/assets adhere to brand guidelines and standards
Partner with IT and 3rd party vendors on development and management of website
Support media tracking requirements
Leverage analytics to enhance overall customer experience

Bachelor’s preferably in Marketing
Minimum 3 years of exp in CMS and website management
Familiarity with the Umbraco platform
Analytics skills with ability to apply findings into recommendations for actions
Website best practices
Strong prioritization skills
Outstanding communication skills (both oral and written) coupled w/ the ability to articulate clearly.
Ability to build relationships/excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Self-directed w/ the ability to exercise independent judgment.

Thank you,

Amy Roberts
amy@staffingstrong.com
Thank you for connecting! What company?
I can send you our confidentiality agreement, we just ask that you keep the client information confidential. What is the best email for you?
Thanks Brian. Our client is Massage Envy.
OK, why would you need an NDA for that?
We ask our candidates information confidential. There are times when candidates are working with multiple agencies and we don't want those other agencies hounding our clients.
OK I don't want to work for a company that only works with one staffing agency.
